java.content: What is the purpose of a constructor in Java?
answers: To create a new object
To destroy an object
To modify an object
To access an object

java.content: What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in Java?
answers: To create a new object
To access a variable or method without creating an object
To modify an object
To destroy an object

java.content: What is the purpose of the 'final' keyword in Java?
answers: To create a new object
To access a variable or method without creating an object
To modify an object
To make a variable or method unchangeable

java.content: What is the purpose of the 'try-catch' block in Java?
answers: To create a new object
To access a variable or method without creating an object
To modify an object
To handle exceptions

java.content: What is the purpose of the 'public' keyword in Java?
answers: To create a new object
To access a variable or method without creating an object
To modify an object
To make a variable or method accessible from anywhere

design patterns.content: What is the purpose of design patterns?
answers: To provide reusable solutions to common programming problems
To make code more complex
To slow down development time
To make code less efficient
A pattern that restricts the instantiation of a class to one object
A pattern that allows for multiple instances of a class
A pattern that only works with strings
A pattern that is only used in web development
A pattern where an object maintains a list of its dependents and is notified when any of its dependents undergo a change
A pattern where an object is created from a prototype
A pattern where an object is created by cloning an existing object
A pattern where an object is created by a factory method
A pattern that creates objects without specifying the exact class to create

A pattern that allows for multiple instances of a class
A pattern that is only used in web development
A pattern that adds behavior to an object dynamically

angular.content: What is a component in Angular?
answers: A reusable piece of code
A database table
A CSS class
A JavaScript function

angular.content: What is data binding in Angular?
answers: A way to connect data between components
A way to style HTML elements
A way to create animations
A way to handle user input

angular.content: What is a directive in Angular?
answers: A way to manipulate the DOM
A way to create variables
A way to handle events
A way to import external libraries

angular.content: What is a service in Angular?
answers: A way to share data between components
A way to create animations
A way to handle user input
A way to style HTML elements
A library for reactive programming
A CSS framework
A database
A JavaScript function
